filmography.title: Goodbye, Mr. Chips
filmography.role_description: The charming young suffragette who marries a shy schoolmaster, transforming him into a beloved figure; her breakout Hollywood role.
filmography.plot: A shy, withdrawn schoolteacher looks back on his long career and the woman who changed his life.

filmography.title: Remember?
filmography.role_description: A woman whose engagement is complicated by a memory-erasing potion in this romantic comedy co-starring Robert Taylor.
filmography.plot: A couple on the verge of divorce takes a potion that makes them forget the last few months, giving them a fresh start.

filmography.title: Pride and Prejudice
filmography.role_description: The witty and independent second daughter of the Bennet family who clashes with the proud Mr. Darcy in this classic adaptation.
filmography.plot: Five sisters in 19th-century England navigate societal pressures and romance to find suitable husbands.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Blossoms in the Dust
filmography.role_description: The real-life activist who fought to remove the stigma of illegitimacy from birth certificates and founded a Texas children's home.
filmography.plot: After losing her own child, a woman dedicates her life to helping orphans and changing the laws regarding illegitimate children.

filmography.title: When Ladies Meet
filmography.role_description: A cheerful wife who unwittingly befriends the female novelist who is pursuing her husband.
filmography.plot: A wife and her husband's potential mistress meet and become friends without realizing they are rivals.

filmography.title: Mrs. Miniver
filmography.role_description: A courageous British matriarch who holds her family together during the Blitz, becoming a symbol of wartime resilience.
filmography.plot: A British family struggles to survive the first months of World War II while their son goes off to fight and their village is bombed.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress; Oscar: Win – Best Picture

filmography.title: Random Harvest
filmography.role_description: A showgirl who marries a shell-shocked WWI veteran with amnesia, only to lose him when he regains his old memories but forgets her.
filmography.plot: An amnesiac veteran falls in love and marries, but a shock restores his old memories while erasing his new life, leaving his wife to win him back.

filmography.title: The Youngest Profession
filmography.role_description: Garson appears as herself, graciously engaging with a group of teenage autograph hunters in New York City.
filmography.plot: Teenage autograph seekers in New York City track down movie stars, leading to complications in their own lives.

filmography.title: Madame Curie
filmography.role_description: The pioneering physicist who discovers radium alongside her husband Pierre, balancing scientific obsession with family life.
filmography.plot: A biography of the French scientists Marie and Pierre Curie and their discovery of radium.

filmography.title: Mrs. Parkington
filmography.role_description: A boarding house maid who marries a wealthy major and evolves into a powerful family matriarch recounting her life story.
filmography.plot: An 84-year-old matriarch recounts her rise from a Nevada boarding house to New York high society.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Drama)

filmography.title: The Valley of Decision
filmography.role_description: An Irish housemaid who falls in love with the son of a steel mill owner, caught in the conflict between labor and management.
filmography.plot: A maid in a Pittsburgh steel family's home falls for the owner's son, bridging the gap between the workers and the owners.

filmography.title: Adventure
filmography.role_description: A reserved librarian who is swept off her feet by a rough-and-tumble merchant marine sailor played by Clark Gable.
filmography.plot: A merchant marine sailor marries a librarian on a whim, but his wandering spirit threatens their marriage.
filmography.awards: Marketed as 'Gable's Back and Garson's Got Him'

filmography.title: Desire Me
filmography.role_description: A war widow in Normandy who falls for a man claiming to have been her husband's friend in a Nazi camp, unaware of his deception.
filmography.plot: A woman believes her husband died in a concentration camp and falls for a fellow prisoner who brings her news, but the husband returns.

filmography.title: Julia Misbehaves
filmography.role_description: A showgirl and estranged mother who joins an acrobatic troupe to crash her daughter's wedding and win back her husband.
filmography.plot: A showgirl tries to get her daughter married off and win back her ex-husband in this screwball comedy.

filmography.title: That Forsyte Woman
filmography.role_description: A woman trapped in a loveless marriage to a wealthy, possessive aristocrat, who finds love with her niece's fiancé.
filmography.plot: The wife of a wealthy, cold Victorian aristocrat falls in love with the architect engaged to her husband's niece.

filmography.title: The Miniver Story
filmography.role_description: Reprising her Oscar-winning role, Kay Miniver faces a terminal illness while trying to resolve her family's post-war problems.
filmography.plot: In this sequel to Mrs. Miniver, the family matriarch discovers she has a terminal heart condition and tries to settle her family's happiness before she dies.

filmography.title: The Law and the Lady
filmography.role_description: A polished lady's maid who teams up with a charming scoundrel to steal jewelry from the wealthy in San Francisco.
filmography.plot: Two con artists team up to swindle high society in San Francisco, but romance complicates their plans.
filmography.awards: Remake of 'The Last of Mrs. Cheyney'

filmography.title: Scandal at Scourie
filmography.role_description: A Protestant woman in Canada who causes a town scandal by adopting a Catholic orphan girl.
filmography.plot: A Protestant couple in a Canadian town adopts a Catholic orphan, causing political and social turmoil.

filmography.title: Julius Caesar
filmography.role_description: The devoted wife of Julius Caesar who has premonitions of his assassination and tries to warn him.
filmography.plot: The growing ambition of Julius Caesar leads a group of Roman senators to plot his assassination.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Win – Best Actor (James Mason)

filmography.title: Her Twelve Men
filmography.role_description: A widow who becomes the first female teacher at an exclusive boys' boarding school, winning over her skeptical students.
filmography.plot: A woman becomes the first female teacher at a boys' boarding school and must win the respect of her students and male colleagues.

filmography.title: Strange Lady in Town
filmography.role_description: A pioneering female doctor from Boston who moves to Santa Fe in 1880 and faces prejudice from the local male doctor.
filmography.plot: A female doctor tries to establish a practice in 1880s Santa Fe, facing opposition from the established male doctor.

filmography.title: Pepe
filmography.role_description: A cameo appearance as herself in this musical comedy featuring a multitude of Hollywood stars.
filmography.plot: A Mexican ranch hand travels to Hollywood to retrieve his beloved horse, encountering numerous celebrities along the way.

filmography.title: Sunrise at Campobello
filmography.role_description: A critically acclaimed portrayal of Eleanor Roosevelt as she helps her husband Franklin cope with polio and return to politics.
filmography.plot: The story of Franklin D. Roosevelt's battle with polio and his family's struggle to support his return to political life.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Drama)

filmography.title: The Singing Nun
filmography.role_description: The supportive but firm Mother Superior of a convent where a young nun becomes a pop music sensation.
filmography.plot: A Belgian nun writes a song that becomes a worldwide hit, but she struggles to reconcile her fame with her vows.

filmography.title: The Happiest Millionaire
filmography.role_description: The patient and elegant wife of an eccentric Philadelphia millionaire who keeps alligators in the conservatory; Garson's final film role.
filmography.plot: An eccentric millionaire's household is turned upside down when his daughter gets engaged, leading to a clash of families.
